core_topic: AI-native venture building for solo operators
core_topic_statement: This site aims to become the most authoritative resource on building scalable businesses as a single operator using AI as a strategic partner for entrepreneurs, builders, and venture creators.
audience: Solo entrepreneurs, indie hackers, venture studio operators, and builders who want to leverage AI to achieve corporate-scale output without traditional startup infrastructure

pillars.name: AI-Human Collaboration Methodology
pillars.description: Frameworks, practices, and mental models for treating AI as a co-founder rather than a tool. This pillar establishes the foundational philosophy that differentiates AI-native building from traditional entrepreneurship.
pillars.why_necessary: This is the core differentiator. Without establishing clear methodology for AI collaboration, the site becomes just another 'AI tools' blog. This pillar positions the site as the authority on the strategic use of AI in business building.
search_queries: how to use AI as co-founder
subtopics: AI prompt engineering for business strategy
Balancing human intuition with AI analysis
AI memory systems for long-term projects
When to trust vs verify AI suggestions

What's the future of human-AI business partnerships?

pillars.name: Rapid Experimentation Frameworks
pillars.description: Structured methodologies for testing business ideas quickly and systematically. This includes the 12-week framework, proof cycles, and decision-making criteria for scale/pivot/kill decisions.
pillars.why_necessary: Methodology is what separates systematic builders from random experimenters. This pillar provides actionable frameworks that readers can implement immediately, establishing the site as a practical resource.
subtopics: Decision frameworks: scale vs pivot vs kill

pillars.name: Anonymous Building Strategy
pillars.description: The strategic advantages of building businesses without personal branding, including faster iteration, honest feedback, and reduced bias. This covers operational anonymity, legal structures, and when to reveal identity.
pillars.why_necessary: Anonymity is a unique angle that most competitors don't cover. This pillar establishes a defensible position and addresses a real pain point for builders who want to test ideas without reputation risk.

pillars.name: Post-Human Entrepreneurship
pillars.description: The paradigm shift where single operators achieve corporate-scale output through AI symbiosis. This covers the death of traditional startup infrastructure, hybrid intelligence, and the new breed of entrepreneurs.
pillars.why_necessary: This is the philosophical and strategic foundation. It explains WHY the old model is broken and positions the site at the forefront of a new movement. This pillar captures high-intent searches from builders questioning traditional approaches.
subtopics: The death of traditional startup infrastructure

pillars.name: AI-Native Product Development
pillars.description: Building products where AI is a core component, not an add-on. This covers AI-first experiences, infrastructure requirements, and the technical architecture of AI-native applications.
pillars.why_necessary: Technical depth is required to establish authority. This pillar addresses the 'how' questions that builders face when actually implementing AI-native products, differentiating from surface-level tool reviews.

pillars.name: Venture Studio Operations
pillars.description: Operating a venture studio with AI-native methodology. This covers portfolio management, parallel experiment execution, automation systems, and the operating system behind scalable venture creation.
pillars.why_necessary: Venture studios are a growing model, but most content focuses on traditional studios. This pillar positions the site as the authority on AI-native studio operations, a unique and defensible position.

pillars.name: AI Tool Stack & Infrastructure
pillars.description: The practical tools, platforms, and infrastructure that enable AI-native building. This covers the operating stack, tool selection criteria, and how to build a self-hosted, API-first development environment.
pillars.why_necessary: Builders need practical, actionable tool recommendations. This pillar provides the 'what to use' answers that complement the 'how to think' content in other pillars, creating a complete resource.

pillars.name: Auto Agent Workflows
pillars.description: Proactive AI agents that generate work for approval and execution. Autonomous agents that solo operators collaborate with to scale operations without hiring. This covers agent design, approval workflows, agent orchestration, and building a team of AI agents.
pillars.why_necessary: This is the practical implementation layer. While 'AI-Human Collaboration' covers the philosophy, this pillar addresses the concrete systems: agents that work autonomously, generate proposals, and execute after approval. This is what enables true solo operator scaling.
subtopics: Building agent teams for solo operators

internal_linking_rules.rule: All blog posts must link to at least one pillar page
internal_linking_rules.implementation: Every post in /posts/ should include at least one contextual link to /insights/{pillar-slug} or /tools
internal_linking_rules.anchor_text_strategy: Use natural, descriptive anchor text that includes the pillar topic (e.g., 'AI collaboration methodology' not 'click here')

internal_linking_rules.rule: All pillar pages must link to homepage and related pillars
internal_linking_rules.implementation: Each /insights/{pillar-slug} page should link to homepage, at least 2 related pillars, and 3-5 supporting articles
internal_linking_rules.anchor_text_strategy: Use pillar names as anchor text for cross-pillar links

internal_linking_rules.rule: Supporting articles link horizontally to related articles
internal_linking_rules.implementation: Articles within the same pillar should link to each other when contextually relevant (minimum 1-2 horizontal links per article)
internal_linking_rules.anchor_text_strategy: Use question-based anchor text that matches search intent (e.g., 'how to structure AI collaboration' links to related how-to article)

internal_linking_rules.rule: Projects link to relevant methodology content
internal_linking_rules.implementation: Each project in /projects/ should link to at least one relevant pillar page and one methodology article
internal_linking_rules.anchor_text_strategy: Link project features to methodology (e.g., 'built using our 12-week framework')

internal_linking_rules.rule: Homepage links to all pillar pages
internal_linking_rules.implementation: Homepage should have clear navigation or featured sections linking to all 8 pillar pages
internal_linking_rules.anchor_text_strategy: Use pillar names as primary navigation labels

internal_linking_rules.rule: Tools page links to methodology pillars
internal_linking_rules.implementation: /tools should link to 'AI-Human Collaboration' and 'AI-Native Product Development' pillars
internal_linking_rules.anchor_text_strategy: Link tool categories to relevant methodology (e.g., 'AI collaboration tools' links to collaboration pillar)

content_to_target_mapping.rule: If article answers 'how to collaborate with AI' questions, it must link to AI-Human Collaboration pillar and existing co-founder article
If article covers experiment methodology, it must link to Experimentation Frameworks pillar and 12-week framework article
If article discusses anonymous operations, it must link to Anonymous Building pillar and existing anonymity article
If article discusses post-human concepts, it must link to Post-Human Entrepreneurship pillar and existing post-human article
If article covers AI product development, it must link to AI-Native Products pillar and relevant project case studies
If article discusses venture studios, it must link to Venture Studio Operations pillar and studio project
If article reviews tools, it must link to Tools page and relevant methodology pillar
If article discusses autonomous agents, agent workflows, or agent orchestration, it must link to Auto Agent Workflows pillar and relevant projects

out_of_scope_topics: General AI news and trends (unless directly related to building methodology)
Generic startup advice without AI-native angle
Personal productivity tips unrelated to business building
Cryptocurrency and blockchain (unless AI-native use case)
Hiring and team management (contradicts solo operator thesis)
Generic marketing advice (must have AI-native or anonymous angle)
Tech stack reviews for non-AI products
Industry-specific advice outside our experiment portfolio
keywords_to_avoid: How to make money with AI (get-rich-quick angle)
AI will replace humans (fear-based, not our thesis)
AI startup ideas (too generic, not methodology-focused)
angles_to_avoid: VC-focused content (we focus on capital-light building)
signals_of_topical_dilution: More than 30% of content is tool reviews without methodology
Content starts covering general entrepreneurship without AI angle
Articles become news-focused rather than evergreen methodology
Internal linking becomes sparse (less than 2 internal links per article)
Pillar pages are not being created or updated
Content doesn't answer specific 'how' or 'why' questions
criteria_for_not_writing: Topic is purely news-based with no evergreen methodology component
Topic doesn't connect to at least one pillar
Topic is too broad and generic (e.g., 'what is AI')
Topic contradicts core thesis (e.g., 'why you need a team')
Topic is already well-covered by competitors without unique angle
Topic requires expertise we don't have (e.g., legal advice)
Topic is trend-only with no long-term search value
